message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.DL 

The paper discusses the feasibility of using crowdsourcing for literature reviews, which involves analyzing and categorizing large amounts of text data. This aligns with several sub-categories in computer science, including Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC), Cybernetics (cs.CY), Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Computational Linguistics (cs.CL), and Machine Learning (cs.DL). However, since the paper focuses on the screening phase of literature reviews, which involves identifying relevant papers based on specific criteria, we can eliminate some of these sub-categories (e.g. cs.CY and cs.DL) that are less directly related to this task. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.HC, which deals with the design and evaluation of interactive systems, followed by cs.CY, cs.IR, cs.CL, and cs.DL.
